definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: Anti-immigration sentiments are stronger in an economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟危機中，反移民的情緒會增長。

sentences.english: Over-producing a commodity can lead to an economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 商品生產過剩會導致經濟危機。

sentences.english: The United States has been hit hard by the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美國是此次經濟危機的重災區。

sentences.english: But the crisis is not over.
sentences.chinese: 但是，經濟危機並沒有結束。

sentences.english: Germany's economic crisis, domestic class contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 德國經濟危機後，國內階級矛盾尖銳。

sentences.english: American liquor companies are finding inspiration in the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 時下，美國酒商從經濟危機中發現了商機。

sentences.english: The economic crisis has intensified the pain from all these burdens.
sentences.chinese: 而經濟危機本身加重了這些負擔帶來的痛感。

sentences.english: And sure, once in office, the administration faced a massive economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 確實，剛剛就位，政府就面臨一場巨大的經濟危機。

sentences.english: A recessionista is a person who stays fashionable during an economic downturn without spending a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 經濟危機好像對大多數人都或多或少產生了一些影響。

sentences.english: The economic crisis grows worse, and harder to resolve, with each passing week.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間的推移，經濟危機日益惡化，難以解決。

sentences.english: Foreign banks boost expansion in China in post-crisis era.
sentences.chinese: 後經濟危機時代，外資銀行在中國的業務將迅速擴張。

sentences.english: The recent economic crisis has led to heavy layoffs .
sentences.chinese: 最近的經濟危機，已經導致大量的資遣。

sentences.english: China’s “leftists” are becoming more active as the global economy sputters.
sentences.chinese: 全球經濟危機以來，中國的左派人士更加活躍了起來。

sentences.english: There are repeated scares and usually it's all right.
sentences.chinese: 經濟危機週而復始但最後總是會結束。

sentences.english: The economic crisis in US began with the subprime mortgage crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美國的經濟危機開始於次貸危機。

sentences.english: The Online Travel Agencies (OTAs) gained market and channel share during the recession.
sentences.chinese: 在線旅行社在經濟危機中佔領了市場與渠道的優勢。

definition: to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to break out (of disease etc)/to suddenly get rich (or prominent)
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
